topics.title: Cannabinoids and Terpenes
topics.description: Detailed information about cannabinoids, terpenes, and their effects on the body and mind.

entries.name: THC (Tetrahydrocannabinol)
entries.notes: Primary psychoactive compound in cannabis responsible for the 'high'.

entries.name: CBD (Cannabidiol)
entries.notes: Does not produce a high; balances THC effects.

entries.name: Myrcene
entries.notes: Most abundant terpene in many strains; enhances THC absorption.

entries.name: Limonene
entries.notes: Common in sativa strains; associated with uplifting effects.

topics.title: Legal Regulations and Safety Guidelines
topics.description: Important information regarding cannabis legality and safe usage practices.

entries.status: Cannabis remains federally illegal under the Controlled Substances Act.
entries.notes: State laws may supersede; always comply with local regulations.

entries.status: Recreational and medical cannabis are legal for adults 21+.

guidelines: Start with low doses and go slow, especially with edibles.
Avoid mixing cannabis with alcohol or other substances.
Do not operate vehicles or heavy machinery while impaired.
Store cannabis securely and away from children and pets.

management: Use CBD-rich strains to balance effects
Rest in a safe, comfortable environment

topics.title: Cannabis Cultivation and Grow Tips
topics.description: Guides on growing cannabis indoors and outdoors, covering environment, nutrients, and lifecycle.

entries.description: First stage after germination; seedlings require low light intensity and high humidity.
Growth stage where plants develop leaves and stems; requires more light and nutrients.
Plants develop buds; light cycles switch to 12 hours dark/light to induce flowering.
tips: Control humidity to 40-50% to prevent mold
Monitor trichomes to determine harvest time

entries.description: Final stage; buds are collected, dried, and cured for consumption.
tips: Harvest when trichomes are cloudy or amber-colored
Dry in a dark, ventilated space at 60-70°F
Cure buds in airtight containers for 2-4 weeks
